sen.j: 諸色（しょしき）とは、江戸時代において物価を指した言葉。
sen.e: Shoshiki was a term to indicate prices of commodities in the Edo Period.
Shoshiki was a term used in the Edo period to indicate the price of commodity.
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代の言葉」となるように構文を変えました
sen.e: Shoshiki was a term used in the Edo period to indicate the price of commodity.

sen.j: 一般的には米を除いた日常品の価格を指す場合が多い。
sen.e: In most cases shoshiki indicated the prices of daily commodities other than rice.
In most cases shoshiki indicated the prices of daily commodities other than rice.
In most cases shoshiki indicated the prices of daily commodities other than rice.

sen.j: 物価の高騰を諸色高直（しょしきこうじき）、低落を諸色下直（しょしきげしき）と呼んだ。
sen.e: Steep price rise was called shoshikikojiki and downslide was called shoshikigeshiki.
Steep price rise was called shoshiki-kojiki and downslide was called shoshiki-geshiki.
sen.cmt: 諸色の複合語だということがわかるよう、ハイフンでつなぎました。諸色高直：shoshiki-kojiki 諸色下直：shoshiki-geshiki.
sen.e: Steep price rise was called shoshiki-kojiki and downslide was called shoshiki-geshiki.

sen.j: 江戸時代においては米価と諸色は連動すると考えられていたが、米の増産による価格低迷が享保年間には「米価安の諸色高直」の現象を招いた。
sen.e: In the Edo Period rice price was considered to link with shoshiki, however, price slump caused by increased production of rice in Kyoho era incurred the phenomenon of 'shoshikikojiki by low rice price.'

In the Edo period rice price was considered to link with shoshiki, however, price slump caused by increased production of rice incurred the phenomenon of 'shoshiki-kojiki by low rice price' in Kyoho era.
sen.cmt: 「米価安の諸色高直」：'shoshiki-kojiki by low rice price'
sen.e: In the Edo period rice price was considered to link with shoshiki, however, price slump caused by increased production of rice incurred the phenomenon of 'shoshiki-kojiki by low rice price' in Kyoho era.

sen.j: 米価と諸色のバランスの調整は、いわゆる「幕政改革」の一環として必ず取り上げられた問題であった。
sen.e: Adjustment of balance between rice price and shoshiki was an issue that always came up as part of so-called 'reformation of the shogunate government.'
Adjustment of a balance between rice price and shoshiki was an issue that always came up as part of so-called 'reformation of the shogunate government.'
sen.cmt: an article 'a' in front of the word 'balance.'
sen.e: Adjustment of a balance between rice price and shoshiki was an issue that always came up as part of so-called 'reformation of the shogunate government.'

sen.j: 享保の改革では、米価が下がっているのに諸色が下がらないのは商人たちが不当に利益を得ているからだとして価格引下げを命じている。
sen.e: Rollback (price-cutting) was issued through the Kyoho Reforms saying that shoshiki didn't fall while rice price was falling because merchants profited unfairly.

In the Kyoho Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kyoho era) a rollback order was issued to the merchants, alleging that the shoshiki showed no sign of easing in spite of the declined rice price because the merchants profited unfairly.
sen.cmt: Rollback (price-cutting) was issued →a rollback order was issued to the merchantsthrough the Kyoho Reforms →in the Kyoho Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kyoho era) saying→alleging
sen.e: In the Kyoho Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kyoho era) a rollback order was issued to the merchants, alleging that the shoshiki showed no sign of easing in spite of the declined rice price because the merchants profited unfairly.

sen.j: 寛政の改革の際には価格監視を目的として江戸町奉行所の与力・同心と町役人による諸色掛（しょしきがかり）が結成されて幕末まで継続されている。
sen.e: At the time of the Kansei Reform Shohikigakari was made up of yoriki (police sergeant), doshin (police constable) from Edo town magistrate's office and machiyakunin (municipal official) in order to observe the price and was kept till the end of the Edo Period.

At the time of the Kansei Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in Kansei era), Shoshiki gakari (a price watchdog) made up of the Edo town magistrate's officials such as yoriki (police sergeant) and doshin (police constables) and the municipal officials was established in order to monitor the prices and it kept functioning until the end of the Edo period.

At the time of the Kansei Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in Kansei era), Shoshiki gakari (a price watchdog) made up of the Edo town magistrate's officials such as yoriki (police sergeant) and doshin (police constables) and the municipal officials was established in order to monitor the prices and it kept functioning until the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 天保の改革においては物価吊り上げの元凶とされた株仲間の解散を行ったが、当時の株仲間がこうした行為を組織ぐるみで行っていたという証拠は無く、却って流通の混乱を生じさせて更なる諸色高直を招いた。
sen.e: Kabunakama (merchant guild) was dissolved through Tenpo Reform as it was considered as the villain of raising the commodity price but there was no evidence of kabunakama's committing such an act systematically those days, and instead, it made the circulation of the market even more troubled causing further shoshikikojiki.

Kabunakama (merchant guilds) were dissolved during the Tenpo Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in Tenpo era) because they were considered as the villain of raising the commodity price, but there was no evidence that the kabunakama were systematically committing such an act, and instead, the dissolution of the guilds made the distribution system even more troubled, causing further shoshiki-kojiki.
sen.cmt: 「株仲間」(同業者連盟）は、業種により複数あったと考えられるので、複数形にしました。
sen.e: Kabunakama (merchant guilds) were dissolved during the Tenpo Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in Tenpo era) because they were considered as the villain of raising the commodity price, but there was no evidence that the kabunakama were systematically committing such an act, and instead, the dissolution of the guilds made the distribution system even more troubled, causing further shoshiki-kojiki.

sen.j: なお、当時の大坂町奉行阿部正蔵は幕府に対して「諸藩の専売制」「一部商人の不正取引」「抜売買の横行（正規外の流通ルート）」を諸色高直の原因として対策を上申したが、採用されなかった。
sen.e: In addition, Shozo ABE, Osaka machi-bugyo (town magistrate of Osaka) of that time, submitted a countermeasure for shoshikikojiki citing 'domains' monopoly,' 'illegal trading by certain merchants' and 'flourishing 抜売買 (outside normal distribution channels)' as a factor of shoshikikoji, however, it did not adopted.

Shozo ABE, Osaka machi-bugyo (town magistrate of Osaka) of that time, submitted a countermeasure for shoshiki-kojiki citing 'domains' monopoly,' 'illegal trading by certain merchants' and 'flourishing nukiurikai (抜売買) (the trade outside normal distribution channels)' as a factor of shoshiki-kojiki, however, it was not adopted.
sen.cmt: In addition, 抜売買：正式な読み方が不明です。nukiurikai (the trade outside normal distribution channels)としました。
sen.e: Shozo ABE, Osaka machi-bugyo (town magistrate of Osaka) of that time, submitted a countermeasure for shoshiki-kojiki citing 'domains' monopoly,' 'illegal trading by certain merchants' and 'flourishing nukiurikai (抜売買) (the trade outside normal distribution channels)' as a factor of shoshiki-kojiki, however, it was not adopted.

sen.j: 更に幕末の開国後の貿易は更なる価格高騰を招いた。
sen.e: Furthermore, trading after Japan's opening to the world at the end of the Edo Period caused additional soaring prices.
Furthermore, trading after Japan's opening to the world at the end of the Edo period caused additional soaring prices.
Furthermore, trading after Japan's opening to the world at the end of the Edo period caused additional soaring prices.

sen.j: そこで慶応年間には生活物資の流通機構を半国営化する「諸色会所」構想が唱えられたが、江戸幕府の滅亡によって実現しなかった。
sen.e: So a concept of 'shoshiki-kaisho,' half-nationalizing of distribution channel of daily commodity was advocated but was not brought to realization owing to the fall of Edo Shogunate.

So a concept of 'shoshiki-kaisho' (shoshiki exchange), a semi-nationalized distribution channel of daily commodity, was advocated, but it was not brought to realization due to the fall of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: Edo Shogunate→Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
sen.e: So a concept of 'shoshiki-kaisho' (shoshiki exchange), a semi-nationalized distribution channel of daily commodity, was advocated, but it was not brought to realization due to the fall of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: なお当時の対中国向け貿易において、いわゆる「俵物三品」以外の輸出品を諸色と呼称していた。
sen.e: Also, in trade with China at that time exported goods other than so-called 'Nagasaki Tawaramono (marine products exported from Nagasaki in premodern times)' were called shoshiki.
In trade with China at that time the exported goods other than so-called 'Tawaramono Sanhin' (three luxury marine products)' were also called 'shoshiki.'
sen.cmt: Alsoを取りました。俵物三品： 'Tawaramono Sanhin' (three luxury marine products)'
sen.e: In trade with China at that time the exported goods other than so-called 'Tawaramono Sanhin' (three luxury marine products)' were also called 'shoshiki.'
